{{nihongo|'''Hideaki Ishi'''|石 英明|Ishi Hideaki|born July 29, 1962}}, better known by his [[stage name]] '''DJ Krush''', is a record producer and DJ. He is known for his atmospheric instrumental production which incorporates sound elements from nature and extensive use of jazz and soul samples.

==Early life==
Ishi was born in [[Tokyo]] in 1962. He dropped out of school at an early age and joined a local gang and, a few years later, the [[yakuza]]. Early in his career as a yakuza underling, Ishi discovered [[Yubitsume|a severed finger]] wrapped in paper on his desk. Later, after discovering that it had belonged to a friend, he decided to leave the yakuza and cut ties with the criminal underworld.<ref>{{cite web|last=Fuller |first=Thomas |url=http://www.iht.com/articles/2002/01/18/kruser_ed3_.php |title=DJ Krush Gives the Turntable an Asian Spin - NYTimes.com |publisher=[[International Herald Tribune]]|date=2002-01-18 |access-date=2012-05-09 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080225205731/http://www.iht.com/articles/2002/01/18/kruser_ed3_.php |archive-date=February 25, 2008 }}</ref><ref name=kronick>{{cite web|last1=Liu|first1=Jeff|title=DJ Krush: Kracking the Code|url=http://www.kronick.com/2.0/issue27/djkrush.shtml|access-date=15 August 2014}}</ref> Ishi was inspired to start DJing after seeing the film ''[[Wild Style]]'' in 1983.<ref name=kronick/><ref>{{cite web|last1=Song |first1=Berwin |title=DJ Krush interview |url=http://www.timeoutshanghai.com/features/Bars__Clubs-Nightlife_features/5019/DJ-Krush-interview.html |website=Time Out Shanghai |access-date=15 August 2014 |date=21 December 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140819082656/http://www.timeoutshanghai.com/features/Bars__Clubs-Nightlife_features/5019/DJ-Krush-interview.html |archive-date=19 August 2014 }}</ref> "When I discovered the film Wild Style in 1983 I found what I really wanted to do, to express myself," he said in a 2015 interview. "Breaking, grafitti, rap, DJ… I always liked music so I chose DJ. My body wasn’t built for breaking, DJing was the thing for me."<ref name="mowaxplease.com">{{cite web|url=https://www.mowaxplease.com/interview-dj-krush/|title=An interview with DJ Krush|date=27 November 2015|website=Mowaxplease.com|access-date=15 April 2019}}</ref>

==Career==
Aside from being considered one of the pioneers of [[Japanese hip hop]],<ref>Condry, Ian. ''Hip-hop Japan: Rap and the Paths of Cultural Globalization''. [[Durham, North Carolina]]: [[Duke University Press]], 2006.</ref> Ishi has established himself as one of the most respected artists and producers in the hip hop industry, both in Japan and abroad. Upon entering the industry, Ishi, with his experimental beats and instrumental sounds, changed the face of hip-hop at a time when it was dominated by the American rap scene. He is reluctant to identify his music with any particular genre, for it would place limits on his listeners and on his talents.<ref>{{cite journal|author=Manabe, Noriko|title="Representing Japan: ‘national’ style among Japanese hip-hop DJs"|journal=Popular Music|volume=32|pages=35-50|doi=10.1017/S0261143012000530|url=https://www.academia.edu/2527373/Representing_Japan_national_style_among_Japanese_hip-hop_DJs}}</ref> He has been regarded as [[ambient music|ambient]], [[trip hop]], some combination of the two, and hip hop. DJ Krush prefers to exercise an ideological distance from the genres he is usually grouped into, while maintaining a healthy appreciation for all music forms and styles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.asiaarts.ucla.edu/article.asp?parentid=83002 |title=Asia Pacific Arts: Krushing Labels |publisher=Asiaarts.ucla.edu |access-date=2013-05-13 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131103105754/http://www.asiaarts.ucla.edu/article.asp?parentid=83002 |archive-date=2013-11-03 }}</ref> Still, in general, he admits to having more affinity to the musical underground than the mainstream. "Hip hop in Japan is divided in two parts. Mainstream and Underground," he says. "Underground is more interesting and I feel comfortable here."<ref name="mowaxplease.com"/>
